agency_desc: A commercial organization with treatment centers throughout Indiana that provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. A virtual intensive outpatient program is available for those not needing residential treatment.
service_description: Provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. Co-occurring disorders such as depression, anxiety, PTSD, and trauma are also treated. Facility has 60 beds.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities

site_schedule.name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities

site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- In need of inpatient alcohol and/or substance use detox or treatment -- Medically stable -- Able to complete activities of daily living (showering, dressing, feeding etc.) -- Able and willing to participate in mandatory programming from day one

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency services; call or visit website for additional information.

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers immediate care for minor injuries and illness, including sore throats, ear infections, colds, flu, pink eye, asthma, sinus infections, allergies, and rashes. X-rays and labs are NOT available at this location.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: AGING AND IN-HOME SERVICES OF NORTHEAST INDIANA - MEAL SITES

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Ligonier in Noble County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Ligonier in Noble County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Ligonier in Noble County.

agency_desc: A community center for local area seniors offering social activities, along with reserved transportation services for everyone regardless of age.
service_description: Offers social and wellness activities, shopping trips, and special events for area seniors. Transportation may be available within set boundaries.

agency_desc: Northeastern Center helps individuals in northeastern Indiana achieve emotional and mental wholeness through accessible, affordable and quality behavioral health services.
service_description: Provides 24-hour phone crisis intervention for persons experiencing a mental health or addiction crisis. Crisis coordinators perform an assessment and then provide appropriate referrals to outpatient services, emergency rooms, pre-hospital screenings, or police contact for a wellness check. Current clients of this agency may use this line to get connected to the doctor-on-call for crisis assistance.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Experiencing a mental health or addiction crisis

agency_desc: Northeastern Center helps individuals in northeastern Indiana achieve emotional and mental wholeness through accessible, affordable and quality behavioral health services.

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in one of the thirteen districts -- Age 3-22 years-old -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering continuing education for adults.
service_description: Offers continuing education for adults with interest in CNA, medical certifications, computer technology, welding, business management, leadership, ASQ Quality, CNC Machinist, APICS,  and more.
site_details: Walk in, call for information, or visit the website.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -OR- Age 16 or 17 for CNA classes with parental permission

agency_desc: A collaborative joint service of thirteen county school corporation that offers educational and vocational training for high school students and continuing adult learners.
service_description: Offers an English as a second language (ESL) course, taught at various levels to enhance socialization and reading ability. Students are required to take a placement test prior to beginning course.
site_details: Call or visit website to register for orientation. -- Visit website for location details.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older (or 16 and older if not enrolled in school) -- Beginning or intermediate English speaker
Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: A city-government provided  emergency fire and medical services.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city. Nonemergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in city of Kendallville in Noble County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides emergency shelter and a safe place to homeless individuals and families, with a range of supportive services.
service_description: Provides an emergency shelter for women and children who are impacted by homelessness, domestic violence, or substance use recovery. Case management and support services are offered to help with job searching, budgeting, life-skills training, and mentoring. Food is provided.
site_details: Call to complete application.
site_eligibility: Women and children only -- Must be drug and alcohol free -- No history of sexual criminal charge/arrest or of a violent charge within the past 5 years

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Noble County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Noble County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable personal property in Noble County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call in advance to check availability for walk-ins. -- Call or email to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry serving those in need in Kosciusko and Noble Counties.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, toilet paper, and meat to those in need based on family size.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open -- Limited one (1) visit every four (4) weeks

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Maintains and operates one public housing complex (Lamplighter Apartments) in the city of Kendallville in Noble County for income-eligible seniors and persons with disabilities. Applications may be accepted on a walk-in basis for the wait list. Rent is approximately 30% of adjusted gross income.
site_details: Walk in or call for information, or to be put on the waiting list.
site_eligibility: Low income -- US citizens and eligible immigrants -- Priority given to persons ages 62 and older and/or persons receiving SSI disability benefits

agency_desc: A government organization that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental apartments to eligible families, seniors, and persons with disabilities. Applications are accepted on a walk-in basis. A wait list is maintained when all units are full. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Walk in or call to request an application.
site_eligibility: Low income -- US citizens and eligible immigrants -- Priority given to persons ages 50 or older, persons receiving SSI disability benefits, and working families

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Noble County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Walk in -OR- Call for more information
site_eligibility: Open
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Noble County

To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Noble County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, seasonal leaf pick-up, dead animal pickup, street-sign maintenance, and grounds-keeping of public properties.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report. -- For after-hour emergencies: call County Dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open
Varies by service; services limited to properties within Avilla town limits

agency_name: HELPING HANDS OF ORANGE TOWNSHIP INC.
agency_desc: A food pantry and clothing bank, located in Noble County.
site_name: HELPING HANDS OF ORANGE TOWNSHIP INC.
service_description: Offers clothing to people of all ages in need. Clothing sizes range from infant to adult. Small household items maybe available based on donations. Donations are accepted for kitchenware, bed linens, and bed frames in good conditions. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; first come first served.
site_eligibility: Open
Limited to zip codes 46784, 46794, 46795

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Varies by service; serves Noble County
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Ligonier in Noble County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Ligonier in Noble County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Noble County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Ligonier in Noble County

agency_desc: A pro-life, nonprofit organization that works to build stronger children, parents and families with education and health care resources.
service_description: Offers free pregnancy tests and pregnancy consultation from trained peer counselors. Provides educational opportunities for parents or potential parents who want to acquire the knowledge and skills to be effective in their parenting role. Services are provided from a pro-life perspective.
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open
Living in or receiving services in Noble County -- Pregnant women or parents/guardians with a child up to age four

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Noble County.
service_description: Maintains the Noble County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)
Open; serves Noble County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Cromwell in Noble County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Cromwell in Noble County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Cromwell in Noble County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to apply for a library card. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in the city of Kendallville, town of Rome City or Orange and Wayne townships in Noble County
Living in the city of Kendallville, town of Rome City, or Orange or Wayne Townships in Noble County.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to apply for a library card. Call for information.

site_schedule.name: Public Internet Access Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-8pm; Tues and Wed 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-5pm; Sat 9am-3pm

site_schedule.name: Public Libraries
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-8pm; Tues and Wed 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-5pm; Sat 9am-3pm

site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- Living, working, or owning property in the city of Kendallville, town of Rome City or Orange and Wayne townships in Noble County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a community dinner and a food pantry.
service_description: Offers a free hot meal to people in need. A grocery give-a-way is available after meal. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education, treatment, and prevention of drug and alcohol use primarily among youth in Noble County.
service_description: Provides substance abuse education and prevention programs  -- Offers information and referral for various community resources -- Website gives list of local meetings of various recovery groups.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Kendallville in Noble County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Kendallville in Noble County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For non emergency services, call the office during business hours or call Noble County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Noble County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 2nd and 4th Mon 8:30am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 2nd and 4th Mon 8:30am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Starke County.
service_description: Maintains the Starke County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18)
Open; serves Starke County
